cab.content:
SECRET
(This Document is the Property of His Britannic Majesty's Government)
BATTLE SITUATION - NOON- 14th? SEPTEMBER, 1918.
1. WESTERN FRONT.
British Front.
It is reported that our troops have taken the whole of AUCHY-LEZ-LA-BASSE. Otherwise there is no change on the British Front.
French Front.
This morning the French attacked in two places cast of SESSIONS and north of the AISNE. No details have yet been received but it is reported that both attacks are making progress, and that so far 1,800 prisoners have been taken.
In the ST. ?HIEL attack later reports state that the advance on the extreme right was not so advanced as was reported last night. PAGNY-SUR-MOSELLE has not been reached.
The line now runs as follows : - COMBRES, HERBEUVILLE, HANHONVILLE, THILLOT, ST. MAURICE, BILLY, HATTONVILLE, CHAUFOUR WOOD, north of ST. BENOIT, through DAHPVITOUX? WOOD, north of XAMMES, JAULNY, VILCEY, NORROY.
The prisoners taken are so far estimated to be 15,000
2. ITALIAN AND MACEDONIAN FRONTS.
No Change.
General Staff,
War Office, S.W.1.
14th September, 1918.
Issued at 12.40 p.m.
